definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: During the world’s first Industrial Revolution, which began in England, branding was slow to develop.
sentences.chinese: 第一次工業革命發生在英國，那時品牌的發展緩慢。

sentences.english: The Industrial Revolution was characterized by specialization of individuals in their work tasks.
sentences.chinese: 工業革命的特點是個體勞動者勞動內容的細化。

sentences.english: The industrial revolution allowed our economies to expand exponentially.
sentences.chinese: 工業革命讓我們的經濟以幾何級數增長。

sentences.english: After all, the industrial revolution is far from finished.
sentences.chinese: 歸根到底，工業革命遠未完結。

sentences.english: The industrial revolution modified the whole structure of English society.
sentences.chinese: 工業革命改變了英國社會的整體結構。

sentences.english: Describe the Second Industrial Revolution and discuss its implications for the labor force.
sentences.chinese: 試述第二次工業革命，並探討其對勞動力之意涵。

sentences.english: The freight station of the pre-revolutionary time.
sentences.chinese: 在工業革命之前的貨物運輸中轉站。

sentences.english: The industrial revolution ushered in factory-made cards in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 19世紀，工業革命開啓了批量生產的大門。

sentences.english: This chapter has examined several cases of partially-successful industrial revolutions.
sentences.chinese: 這一個章節已經審查部份在工業革命成功的案例。

sentences.english: This is completely different than what we've seen since the Industrial Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 這跟工業革命以來我們所認知的一切是截然不同的。

sentences.english: The Industrial Revolution is a long train of changes starting about 1760.
sentences.chinese: 工業革命是指約1760年開始的一系列變革。

sentences.english: Britain's industrial revolution began in the royal dockyards.
sentences.chinese: 英國工業革命開始在皇家船塢。

sentences.english: This led not only to industrial changes but shifts in politics and society.
sentences.chinese: 這不僅導致了工業革命，也導致了政治和社會的變遷。

sentences.english: Early in the industrial revolution, workplaces typically had no clocks.
sentences.chinese: 早在工業革命時代，工作場所一般沒有鐘錶。

pinyin: Er4 ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

definition: agricultural worker/abbr. for 農業工人|农业工人/peasant and worker (in Marxism)
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
modernization of agriculture, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations
